Network module

class network.Connection(node1: Node, node2: Node, canvas: Canvas)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a connection between two nodes, visualized as a line on the canvas.

check()[source]

Updates the visual representation of the connection based on the nodes’ states.

getFirstNode()[source]

Returns the first node in the connection.

Returns: Node: The first node in the connection.

getSecondNode()[source]

Returns the second node in the connection.

Returns: Node: The second node in the connection.

hasNode(node: Node)[source]

Checks if the connection includes the given node.

Parameters: node (Node): The node to check.

Returns: bool: True if the node is in the connection, False otherwise.

class network.Map(canvas)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a simulation map, responsible for handling the creation of nodes and connections, as well as the simulation loop.

createConnections()[source]

Creates connections between nodes based on the average node degree.

createMap()[source]

Creates the nodes with random positions on the canvas.

getDistance(node1, node2)[source]

Calculates the Euclidean distance between two nodes.

Parameters: node1 (Node): The first node. node2 (Node): The second node.

Returns: float: The Euclidean distance between the two nodes.

infectNodes()[source]

Infects nodes at the start of the simulation based on the initial outbreak size.

isMapLoaded()[source]

Returns whether the map has been loaded or not.

Returns: bool: True if the map is loaded, False otherwise.

reset()[source]

Resets the map, clearing the canvas and nodes.

setup(speed, numberOfNodes, avgNodeDegree, initialOutbreakSize, virusSpreadChance, virusCheckFreq, recoveryChance, gainResistChance)[source]

Initializes the map for the simulation with the given parameters.

Parameters: :param: speed: The speed of the simulation in milliseconds. :type: speed: int numberOfNodes (int): The number of nodes to create. avgNodeDegree (int): The average number of connections each node should have. initialOutbreakSize (int): The number of nodes to infect at the start of the simulation. virusSpreadChance (float): The chance of the virus spreading to a neighbor node. virusCheckFreq (int): The number of ticks between each virus spread check. recoveryChance (float): The chance of an infected node recovering. gainResistChance (float): The chance of a recovered node gaining resistance to the virus.

tick()[source]

Handles the simulation loop. Updates the states of nodes and checks for new infections.

class network.Node(canvas, x: int, y: int, state: State, virusSpreadChance, virusCheckFreq, recoveryChance, gainResistChance)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a node in the simulation that can be in one of the following states: SUSCEPTIBLE, INFECTED, RECOVERED, or RESISTANT.

addConnection(connection: Connection, neighbor: Node)[source]

Adds an existing connection between this node and a neighbor.

Parameters: connection (Connection): The connection to add. neighbor (Node): The neighboring node to add.

becomeResistant()[source]

Makes the node resistant to the virus.

check()[source]

Checks the current state of the node and updates the next state.

createConnection(neighbor: Node)[source]

Creates a connection between this node and a neighbor node.

Parameters: neighbor (Node): The neighboring node to connect to.

Returns: bool: True if the connection was created successfully, False otherwise.

getDegree()[source]

Returns the number of neighbors this node has.

Returns: int: The degree of the node.

getState()[source]

Returns the current state of the node.

Returns: State: The current state of the node.

infect()[source]

Infects the node and tries to infect its neighbors.

isNeighbor(node: Node)[source]

Checks if the given node is a neighbor of this node.

Parameters: node (Node): The node to check.

Returns: bool: True if the node is a neighbor, False otherwise.

recover()[source]

Makes the node recover and return to the susceptible state.

setNextState(state: State)[source]

Sets the next state of the node.

Parameters: state (State): The state to set for the next tick.

setState(state: State)[source]

Sets the state of the node.

Parameters: state (State): The state to set.

tick()[source]

Updates the state of the node based on its current state.

class network.State[source]

Bases: object

Represents the different possible states a node can be in during the simulation.

INFECTED = 2
RECOVERED = 3
RESISTANT = 4
SUSCEPTIBLE = 1
